item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 12.03.20
item.contentencoded:
For this month's show, we have an International Women's Day round-up and we  invited Hello Sassy to talk about Sin Sync, a school to learn how to mix. Hello Sassy also gave us an exclusive live 30min mix. Enjoy!

  • HAAi - Growing up with muscle cars - Motorik Voodoo Bush Doof Musik (Coconut Beats, 2018)

  • Rrucculla - Agave Dance (2019)

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 13.02.20
item.contentencoded:
For this show, we invited Nerea, half of Sisters OutLaw, to talk about our event for Women's day on March 8th. She also graces us with a mix, afterwards.

  • Love Yi & Aleesha - Por Qué Será - Fortuna (Love Yi, 2019)

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 24.10.19
item.contentencoded:
This month we speak to Chloë Lewer, a.k.a singer/songwriter B O K E H. The South African-born, New Zealand-raised, Berlin-based multitalented artist comes from a background in filmmaking, acting and directing - most recently having directed the music video for her newest single ‘Options’ which explores themes of gender, sexuality and identity. We end the show with a mix from TIMANTI (Last Night On Earth).

  • Interview with B O K E H

  • B O K E H - Options - Options - B O K E H - 2019

  • Mix by Timanti

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 26.09.18
item.contentencoded:
SSS Radio is back after a long summer break, and to kick things off we're joined by very special guests Andreea Magdelina (founder of ShesaidSo) and Georgia Taglietti (director of the Barcelona branch of ShesaidSo)!

Together, they gave us a glimpse in to next weeks first ever MEETSSS, a Female first, Music forward event, aimed to explore the music industry through the female lens, from the 3rd to the 6th of October in Portimão, Portugal.

Tracklist for for Show

  • BarcelonaParis - Fábia Maia

  • Da Capo (feat. Dutch Nazari) - CRLN

  • Lotta Love - Da Chick

  • Grrrl Like - Dope Saint Jude

  • Wait N See - Perera Elsewhere

  • La Colère - Calling Marian

Tracklist Mix

  • Hungboo Dj Kicks - Peggy Gou

  • Midas - Maribou Sate (Ben Pearce remix)

  • Rose Rouge - St Germain

  • Hear the Sun - Session Victim

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 06.06.19
item.contentencoded:
This month Jay aka Samsön joined us to co-host and chat about moving to Barcelona,  joining Shesaidso, and everything that has come from that. 

We also chatted to dj duo and sisters Frank London from Sweet Lemonade who provided us an amazing mix tape and told us all about their weekend at Primavera Sound! 

Tracklist for show

  • Checkmate - Kerri Chandler (Cinthie Remix)

  •  It should've been you - Gwen Guthrie 

Tracklist mix

  • Different Planet - Lion Babe 

  • She Lives In My Lap - Outkast 

  • No Time - Playboy Carti ft. Gunna

  • Shea Butter Baby - Ar Lennox Ft. J. Cole

  • Paid - Sudan ArchivesMake Me Well - Sango

  • Two Thousand and Seventeen - Four Tet

  • Ladies - slowthai 

  • I Want You - Kofi Magnetic

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 11.04.19
item.contentencoded: On the SheSaidSo BCN radio show in April we talk to the wonderful Viv @blondish about her ByeByePlastics project - a new initiative with the intention of eradicating single use plastics in the music industry and beyond. We discuss how artists, promoters and the general public can make a difference by replacing single-use plastics with environmentally sustainable alternatives for our beloved planet.  + a mix by Blondish

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 14.03.19
item.contentencoded:
On the 7th March, SheSaidSo BCN celebrated International Women’s Day by taking over Casa Bonay, King Kong Lady and Nica with a full day of women-led events, talks and activations with the participation of Pioneer, All Women.Tech, chef Marietta Richter (Extra Bar, Direkte), sommelier Nuria Renom (Bar Brutal) and an all female music line-up including Troya Modet, Titi Calor and PRETTY PRETTY 2000. We round up the highlights from the event with interviews from some of the key participants and finish the show with a 30min mix by Sonido Tupinamba.

  • cocorosie - Limonade - Grey Oceans (Sub Pop, 2010)

  • rrucculla - Icy Blue Coral - Icy Blue Coral (n/a, 2018)

  • solange - almeda - when i get home (saint records, 2019)

  • La Yegros - solo (kosta kostov remix) - Womex ReMixes vol.2 (GCMN, 2016)

  • + a mix by Sonido Tupinamba

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 14.02.19
item.contentencoded:
For this February edition of SheSaid.So radio we explore some recent developments - our newly launched SheSaid.So Spain programme, plus an announcement with our plans for International Women’s Day on Friday 8th March. Dublab Radio hosts Mia Margetic, Annabelle Pain and Ella Carreras are joined by SSSo Barcelona boss lady Georgia Taglietti who talks us through the news, and fellow SSSo member Jay Samson swings through and provides a 30min guest mix…

  • Samson [30min mix]

  • Branko & Sango - Hear From You (feat. Cosima) - Nosso (Enchufada, 2019)

  • Brat Star - Burn The Baby With The Bathwater - (Bala Club, 2018)

  • Catnapp - No Cover - No Cover (Monkey Town Records, 2018)

  • RRUCCULLA - Icy Blue Coral - Shush (BIIPBIIP, 2018)

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 17.01.19
item.contentencoded:
2019 - brand new year, brand new schedule, brand new lineup (almost). Veteran SheSaidSo host Mia Margetic welcomes fresh co-presenters Annabelle Pain and Ella Carreras to the expanding radio family, as we kick start the year with a special episode on the Tupper_ festival, now in it’s 5th year and taking place 17-19th January across various Barcelona venues. Joined by guests Pat Quintero (PR and communications specialist) and Anna Mastrollito (LiveSoundtracks & She’s In Control founder) we talk about the multitude of events, shows, workshops happening over the 3 days, interspersed with a selection of our favourite tracks from the last year.

  • Bomba Estéreo - Flower Power - Ayo (Sony Music Latin, 2017)

  • Rosalía - Pienso En Tu Mirá (Cap.3 Celos) - El Mal Querer (Sony Music, 2018)

  • Nightwave - Limelight - Sanctuary (Fool's Gold Records, 2018)

  • Terrence - Bubbling Away - Movie Makers (Tofistock, 2018)

  • AK - Original Mix - Cora Novoa - Mental Diary (ACT1) (Seeking The Velvet, 2018)

  • Parallax, TR - Referendoom - Breakxit (Geometrika FM, 2018)

  • RRUCCULLA - Cicatriz De Chocolate - Shush (BIIPBIIP, 2018)

  • Nightwave, Chippy Nonstop - Lotto - Wavejumper (Fool's Gold Records, 2017)

  • Nightwave - Sanctuary - Sanctuary (Fool's Gold Records, 2018)

  • In Orbitae (Ylia Remix) - Killin's Ürcos - M25 (Set Theory Records, 2018)

item.contentencoded: img-5c46e1b021c67cc78dcfb185

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 20.12.18
item.contentencoded:
This month SheSadSo radio speaks to the Portugese-born, London-based DJ Mafalda. Not only an amazing record selector, regular radio host for Red Bull and NTS, co-manager of Floating Points’ International Melodies label releases and it’s accompanying zine, in the little left of her spare time Mafalda also spins records at some of the best festivals in the world.

We chat about her journey from Porto to London, her musical inspirations, learning to play the piano... and which songs she’ll bring out to save a dance floor. Ok, full disclosure - she doesn’t give that last one away but she does curate 45 minutes of blissfully eclectic soul, jazz and r’n’b grooves for us, undeniably establishing why she’s one of the most exciting record selectors out there right now.

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 22.11.18
item.contentencoded:
For this month's episode of SheSaid.So Radio on DubLab BCN, Mia Margetic and D.N.S invite Priscilla Andrade onto the show. With more than 20 years in the entertainment industry Priscilla has worked with some of the greats from tour managing The Avalanches to working with Sophie live on tour, Red Bull Music Academy, Boiler Room, Sonar, Primavera Sound and artists including Hot Chip, Soulwax, Tiga, Britney ... the list goes on. This broadcast is dedicated to her stories and special moments in relation to the artists and tracks played throughout the show.

  • Corey Hart - Sunglasses At Night - The Singles (EMI America, 1983)

  • Tiga - Sunglasses At Night - Sunglasses At Night (International DJ , 2001)

  • Hot Chip - Dancing in the Dark - Dancing in the dark (domino records, 2015)

  • SoulWax - Essential 3 - Essential (DeeWee, 2018)

  • The Avalanches - Since i left you - Since i left you (Modular Recordings, 2000)

  • Hot Chip - Atomic Bomb (cover) - What?! (Luka Pop, 2014)

  • Red Axis - 5 Min - Nyx Tape (Dark Entries, 2017)

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 25.10.18
item.contentencoded:
Post ADE and for this month's episode of SheSaid.So Radio on DubLab BCN, Mia Margetic and DNS invite Ariane Paras onto the show to discuss 'The ingredients of a self-care routine that keeps you mentally and physically healthy'. With twenty years in the music and nightlife business and more than ten in personal development, Ariane is a Life Coach who helps artists and music industry professionals reach the next stage of their lives and careers with more balance, clarity and confidence. Listen back to the show to hear Ariane's 5 pilars of self care and head over to her website where she shares her tips on how to stay happy and anxiety-free https//www.olympiacoaching.com/the-olympian/

  • Lahun - Slow Love (Instrumental) - Slow Love (Apollo Records, 2016)

  • Cocteau Twins - My Truth - Four-Calendar Cafe (Mercury Records, 1993)

  • Mary Lattimore - Hello from the Edge of the Earth - Hundreds of Days  (Ghostly International, 2018)

  • Vangelis - Ask The Mountains - Voices (Warner Music UK, 1995)

  • Blue Gas - Shadows From Nowhere - Shadows From Nowhere (Best Record Italy, 2016)

  • Blondish - Circus - Circus (ABRACADABRA, 2018)

  • Khidja - Kraftfeld (Lena Willikens remix) - Impossible Holiday Remixes (Hivern, 2018)

  • Andhim - Miles to Go - Stay Close To Me (Superfriends Records, 2018)

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 27.09.18
item.contentencoded:
For the first show back of the new season D.N.S flies solo with talk of the new shesaidso mix series, which kicks off in October with South American based trio Menores. Chat and music from 12Tree, Giganta, Ellen Alien plus new tracks from the forthcoming EP by No Data Available on Kirsti Weir's Null+Void, rounding off with an extra hour of D.N.S in the mix.

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 14.06.18
item.contentencoded:
For this month's episode of SheSaid.So Radio on DubLab BCN, Mia Margetic and D.N.S welcome two of the world's leading ladies in nightlife culture Judy Griffith - Heading up promotion and shaping the sound of Saturday night at London’s leading underground music venue Fabric since the beginning alongside Craig Richards - and Toi.Toi.Musik founder Isis Salvaterra who has established herself as one of the most respected figures in the underground music scene.  

They join us live in the studio today with talk about the Toi Toi and Fabric Off Week party at Wolf where they join forces for the first time and celebrate five years of Toi Toi in Barcelona. 

D.N.S rounds off the show with a fresh DJ mix. To listen to the full mix head over to her soundcloud page - https//soundcloud.com/dnsbeats

This show is dedicated to our dear friend Liz Edwards who sadly passed away earlier this month. A true pioneer and legend of her time.  

  • Craig Richards - My friend is losing his mind - The Nothing Special (2017)

  • Interview with Judy and Isis

  • Ion Ludwig - Not For You - Toi.Toi.Musik (2017)

D.N.S DJ mix tracklist

  • Gauss - Bimodal - Ornate Music (2018)

  • Cardopusher - Mental Jobs - Super Rhythm Trax (2018)

  • Hugo Massien - 0011 - E-Beamz (2018)

  • People You May Know - Naive Realism - Hooded Records (2018) A Sagittariun - Stingray - Elastic Dreams (2017)

  • Hugo Massien - Andromeda Signal - E-Beamz (2018)

  • 96 Back - 085 - CPR (2018)

  • LA-4A - Vague Complaint - CPR (2018)

item.title: SheSaid.So Barcelona 17.05.18
item.contentencoded:
For this month's episode of SheSaid.So Radio on DubLab BCN, Mia Margetic and DNS discuss the ins and outs of running a festival with two special guests whose experience covers both sides of the Atlantic - Georgia Taglietti (Head of Communication and Marketing for Sónar Barcelona), and Bolivian-born DJ and Producer IVA, whose Electro Preste festival in La Paz has already become one of the biggest events in the Bolivian cultural calendar. We finish off the show with an exclusive mix from IVA, whose masterful selection of techno tunes might even include some upcoming unreleased material of her own. Keep an ear out. 

  • Goldlink - Meditation - At What Cost - RCA

  • Sophie - Faceshopping - Transgressive Records

  • Yaeji - Raingurl - EP2 - Godmode

  • Iva's 30 minute Mix
